title: Introduction to Optics and Imaging
description:
This course combines theoretical concepts with experimentation and
computational analysis to give a solid introduction to the field of optics
and imaging. A fundamental understanding of the nature of light, and how
it interacts with physical systems is important for many higher level
courses. In this course students will learn geometrical optics, wave optics,
polarization, interference, diffraction and how these concepts relate to
imaging. Students will also be introduced to modern applications of optics
that have had a significant impact on our lives such as lasers and optical
communication.
